events.name: Military coup in Burkina Faso
events.wd_description: The military coup in Burkina Faso deposed President Roch Kabore, prompted by demands for better security and increased instability in the region.
events.description: The military coup in Burkina Faso deposed President Roch Kabore, prompted by demands for better security and increased instability in the region.

events.name: President deposed
events.wd_description: Mutinous soldiers announced the deposition of President Roch Kabore amid demands for more support in fighting armed groups.
events.description: Mutinous soldiers announced the deposition of President Roch Kabore amid demands for more support in fighting armed groups.

events.name: t: soldier mutiny
events.wd_description: Soldiers demanded more support for their fight against armed groups and subsequently deposed President Kabore.
events.description: Soldiers demanded more support for their fight against armed groups and subsequently deposed President Kabore.

events.name: t: popular support
events.wd_description: The coup was greeted with significant support in Burkina Faso.
events.description: The coup was greeted with significant support in Burkina Faso.

events.name: t: military leadership
events.wd_description: Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba emerged as the leader of the coup and was named the leader of the new Patriotic Movement for Safeguard and Restoration (MPSR).
events.description: Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Sandaogo Damiba emerged as the leader of the coup and was named the leader of the new Patriotic Movement for Safeguard and Restoration (MPSR).

events.name: rise in violence
events.wd_description: Burkina Faso has experienced a significant increase in violence from armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL.
events.description: Burkina Faso has experienced a significant increase in violence from armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL.

events.name: t: armed groups
events.wd_description: Armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL have been operating in Burkina Faso since 2015.
events.description: Armed groups linked to al-Qaeda and ISIL have been operating in Burkina Faso since 2015.

events.name: t: increased attacks
events.wd_description: The number of attacks has risen significantly, with over 1,150 incidents in 2021 compared to nearly 500 in 2020.
events.description: The number of attacks has risen significantly, with over 1,150 incidents in 2021 compared to nearly 500 in 2020.

events.name: t: civilian displacement
events.wd_description: More than 1.4 million people have been displaced by the conflict in Burkina Faso.
events.description: More than 1.4 million people have been displaced by the conflict in Burkina Faso.

events.name: international reactions
events.wd_description: The coup has sparked widespread international condemnation and prompted discussions on how to respond to the instability.
events.description: The coup has sparked widespread international condemnation and prompted discussions on how to respond to the instability.

events.name: t: international condemnation
events.wd_description: The international community, including various countries and organizations, has condemned the coup.
events.description: The international community, including various countries and organizations, has condemned the coup.

events.name: t: ECOWAS response
events.wd_description: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) is holding a special session to discuss the coup and potential responses.
events.description: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) is holding a special session to discuss the coup and potential responses.

events.name: t: potential sanctions
events.wd_description: Western allies are considering imposing sanctions on Burkina Faso in response to the coup.
events.description: Western allies are considering imposing sanctions on Burkina Faso in response to the coup.

events.name: regional instability
events.wd_description: The coup is the fourth in a series of recent military takeovers in West and Central Africa, contributing to regional instability.
events.description: The coup is the fourth in a series of recent military takeovers in West and Central Africa, contributing to regional instability.

events.name: UK Sanctions on Russia
events.wd_description: The UK has announced 65 new sanctions targeting strategic industries, banks, and business elites aiding Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, bringing the total sanctioned individuals and businesses to over 1,000 since the invasion.
events.description: The UK has announced 65 new sanctions targeting strategic industries, banks, and business elites aiding Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, bringing the total sanctioned individuals and businesses to over 1,000 since the invasion.

events.name: New Sanctions Announcement
events.wd_description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss announced 65 new sanctions against a range of key strategic industries and individuals supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
events.description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss announced 65 new sanctions against a range of key strategic industries and individuals supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

events.name: Key Targets of Sanctions
events.wd_description: The sanctions target industries and individuals supporting the invasion, including Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, Wagner Group, Alfa Bank, Alrosa, and several high-profile individuals.
events.description: The sanctions target industries and individuals supporting the invasion, including Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, Wagner Group, Alfa Bank, Alrosa, and several high-profile individuals.

events.name: t: Industries Targeted
events.wd_description: Sanctions target key industries supporting the invasion, such as Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, and the Wagner Group.
events.description: Sanctions target key industries supporting the invasion, such as Russian Railways, Kronshtadt, and the Wagner Group.

events.name: t: Individuals Targeted
events.wd_description: Sanctions target individuals including Eugene Shvidler, Oleg Tinkov, Herman Gref, and Polina Kovaleva, among others.
events.description: Sanctions target individuals including Eugene Shvidler, Oleg Tinkov, Herman Gref, and Polina Kovaleva, among others.

events.name: Impact and Measures
events.wd_description: The sanctions include asset freezes, travel bans, and transport sanctions, aiming to degrade the Russian economy and prevent sanctioned individuals from conducting business in the UK.
events.description: The sanctions include asset freezes, travel bans, and transport sanctions, aiming to degrade the Russian economy and prevent sanctioned individuals from conducting business in the UK.

events.name: t: Asset Freeze
events.wd_description: The asset freeze prevents any UK citizen or business from dealing with funds or economic resources owned, held, or controlled by the designated person.
events.description: The asset freeze prevents any UK citizen or business from dealing with funds or economic resources owned, held, or controlled by the designated person.

events.name: t: Travel Ban
events.wd_description: The travel ban prevents designated individuals from entering or remaining in the UK.
events.description: The travel ban prevents designated individuals from entering or remaining in the UK.

events.name: t: Transport Sanctions
events.wd_description: Transport sanctions make it a criminal offense for any Russian aircraft to fly or land in the UK, and ban Russian ships from UK ports.
events.description: Transport sanctions make it a criminal offense for any Russian aircraft to fly or land in the UK, and ban Russian ships from UK ports.

events.name: North Korea's Missile Test and Its Implications
events.wd_label: North Korea's Missile Test and Its Implications
events.wd_description: North Korea conducted its largest-ever missile test, launching the Hwasong-17 intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) which demonstrates its nuclear capabilities and poses a significant challenge to the US and its allies.
events.description: North Korea conducted its largest-ever missile test, launching the Hwasong-17 intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) which demonstrates its nuclear capabilities and poses a significant challenge to the US and its allies.

events.name: Missile Test
events.wd_description: North Korea launched the Hwasong-17 ICBM, the largest liquid-fuelled missile ever launched from a road-mobile launcher, capable of reaching targets 15,000 kilometers away.
events.description: North Korea launched the Hwasong-17 ICBM, the largest liquid-fuelled missile ever launched from a road-mobile launcher, capable of reaching targets 15,000 kilometers away.

events.name: t: Missile Launch Details
events.wd_description: The missile flew higher and longer than any previous North Korean tests before crashing into the sea west of Japan.
events.description: The missile flew higher and longer than any previous North Korean tests before crashing into the sea west of Japan.

events.name: t: Kim Jong Un's Statement
events.wd_description: Kim Jong Un stated that the test was a demonstration of North Korea's nuclear capabilities to deter US military actions and due to escalating military tensions.
events.description: Kim Jong Un stated that the test was a demonstration of North Korea's nuclear capabilities to deter US military actions and due to escalating military tensions.

events.name: t: Missile Specifications
events.wd_description: Analysts noted that the Hwasong-17 is the largest liquid-fuelled missile launched from a road-mobile launcher and could reach the entire US mainland with a warhead weighing less than a tonne.
events.description: Analysts noted that the Hwasong-17 is the largest liquid-fuelled missile launched from a road-mobile launcher and could reach the entire US mainland with a warhead weighing less than a tonne.

events.name: Implications for the US and Allies
events.wd_label: Implications for the US and Allies
events.wd_description: The missile test poses a direct challenge to the US amidst the Russia-Ukraine conflict and raises the prospect of a new crisis with the election of a conservative administration in South Korea.
events.description: The missile test poses a direct challenge to the US amidst the Russia-Ukraine conflict and raises the prospect of a new crisis with the election of a conservative administration in South Korea.

events.name: t: US Response
events.wd_description: The US condemned the missile test, with US Secretary of Defence discussing response measures with counterparts in South Korea and Japan, and announced sanctions on entities supporting North Korea's missile program.
events.description: The US condemned the missile test, with US Secretary of Defence discussing response measures with counterparts in South Korea and Japan, and announced sanctions on entities supporting North Korea's missile program.

events.name: t: South Korea's Reaction
events.wd_description: South Korea's President-elect Yoon Suk-yeol condemned the test and responded with live-fire drills of its own missiles, indicating a revival of tensions.
events.description: South Korea's President-elect Yoon Suk-yeol condemned the test and responded with live-fire drills of its own missiles, indicating a revival of tensions.

events.name: t: Potential Crisis
events.wd_description: The missile test raises the prospect of a new crisis with the election of a conservative administration in South Korea, which has pledged a stronger military strategy against Pyongyang.
events.description: The missile test raises the prospect of a new crisis with the election of a conservative administration in South Korea, which has pledged a stronger military strategy against Pyongyang.

events.name: International Reactions
events.wd_description: The missile test drew condemnation from international leaders, including the US and Japan, and prompted discussions on strengthening defense cooperation among allies.
events.description: The missile test drew condemnation from international leaders, including the US and Japan, and prompted discussions on strengthening defense cooperation among allies.

events.name: t: Condemnation from Leaders
events.wd_description: Leaders from the US and Japan condemned North Korea's missile test.
events.description: Leaders from the US and Japan condemned North Korea's missile test.

events.name: t: Defense Cooperation
events.wd_description: US Secretary of Defence held discussions with South Korea and Japan to strengthen defense cooperation in response to North Korean missile activities.
events.description: US Secretary of Defence held discussions with South Korea and Japan to strengthen defense cooperation in response to North Korean missile activities.

events.name: European EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_label: European EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_description: Volkswagen and Robert Bosch have agreed to establish a joint venture to expand the production of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles (EVs) in Europe, aiming to increase battery production and establish a localized supply chain.
events.description: Volkswagen and Robert Bosch have agreed to establish a joint venture to expand the production of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles (EVs) in Europe, aiming to increase battery production and establish a localized supply chain.

events.name: Volkswagen and Bosch Joint Venture
events.wd_description: Volkswagen and Bosch have agreed to establish a joint venture by the end of 2022 to supply integrated battery production systems and maintenance support for battery cell and system manufacturers.
events.description: Volkswagen and Bosch have agreed to establish a joint venture by the end of 2022 to supply integrated battery production systems and maintenance support for battery cell and system manufacturers.

events.name: t: Supply Integrated Battery Systems
events.wd_description: The joint venture will supply integrated battery production systems, aiming to support the large-scale manufacturing of battery cells and systems.
events.description: The joint venture will supply integrated battery production systems, aiming to support the large-scale manufacturing of battery cells and systems.

events.name: t: Maintenance Support for Battery Manufacturers
events.wd_label: t: Maintenance Support for Battery Manufacturers
events.wd_description: The joint venture will provide maintenance support for battery cell and system manufacturers to ensure efficient production processes.
events.description: The joint venture will provide maintenance support for battery cell and system manufacturers to ensure efficient production processes.

events.name: European Battery Production Expansion
events.wd_description: European battery production is expected to increase dramatically by 2030, with VW planning to have six battery-making facilities in operation by then.
events.description: European battery production is expected to increase dramatically by 2030, with VW planning to have six battery-making facilities in operation by then.

events.name: t: Volkswagen Battery Facilities
events.wd_description: Volkswagen aims to have six battery-making facilities in operation in Europe by 2030 to meet the growing demand for EV batteries.
events.description: Volkswagen aims to have six battery-making facilities in operation in Europe by 2030 to meet the growing demand for EV batteries.

events.name: t: Automotive Cells Company (ACC) Projects
events.wd_description: ACC plans to establish two gigafactories in France and Germany, with a pilot plant already running in Nersac, France, to increase battery production in Europe.
events.description: ACC plans to establish two gigafactories in France and Germany, with a pilot plant already running in Nersac, France, to increase battery production in Europe.

events.name: t: Investments in Battery Production
events.wd_description: Investments by companies like Bosch, Borgwarner, and Dräxlmeier are increasing to become large-scale lithium-ion battery suppliers, supporting the shift to electric powertrains.
events.description: Investments by companies like Bosch, Borgwarner, and Dräxlmeier are increasing to become large-scale lithium-ion battery suppliers, supporting the shift to electric powertrains.

events.name: Localization of Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: European companies are working to establish a fully localized supply chain for battery production to reduce logistics costs, carbon footprint, and ensure security of supply.
events.description: European companies are working to establish a fully localized supply chain for battery production to reduce logistics costs, carbon footprint, and ensure security of supply.

events.name: t: VW and Northvolt Joint Ventures
events.wd_label: t: VW and Northvolt Joint Ventures
events.wd_description: Volkswagen has increased its ownership in Northvolt and acquired shares in the Northvolt Zwei joint venture in Salzgitter, Germany, to build a 16GWh battery-production facility by 2024.
events.description: Volkswagen has increased its ownership in Northvolt and acquired shares in the Northvolt Zwei joint venture in Salzgitter, Germany, to build a 16GWh battery-production facility by 2024.

events.name: t: Local Battery Production Initiatives
events.wd_description: Volkswagen is making batteries at its Braunschweig components plant in Germany, with cells delivered from LG Chem’s plant in Poland for supply to the Zwickau EV assembly plant.
events.description: Volkswagen is making batteries at its Braunschweig components plant in Germany, with cells delivered from LG Chem’s plant in Poland for supply to the Zwickau EV assembly plant.
